subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Friday, 11 May, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Sanchez quits NI for Fulham post
Lawrie Sanchez resigns as Northern Ireland manager to take over at Fulham.



 
Fowler to leave Anfield in summer
Liverpool striker Robbie Fowler confirms his contract will not be extended at the end of this season.



 
West Ham sure on Tevez clearance
West Ham say they have provided the Premier League with documents proving Carlos Tevez is eligible to play for them.








GOLF




Players' Ch'ship leaderboard
Leading scores from the second round at Sawgrass.



 
Westwood hits form in Andalucia
Lee Westwood fires an eight-under-par second round to challenge for the lead at the Andalucia Open.



 
Andalucia Open leaderboard
Latest updates from the European Tour event in Marbella.








MOTORSPORT




Alonso bounces back to set pace
World champion Fernando Alonso's McLaren is well clear of the field as he sets the fastest time in Friday practice at the Spanish Grand Prix.



 
Singapore to stage F1 night race
Singapore will stage a Formula One Grand Prix next year, with the race set to be the first to be held at night.



 
Schumi hails precocious Hamilton
Michael Schumacher says he is not surprised by Lewis Hamilton's superb start in F1.








FORMULA ONE




Alonso bounces back to set pace
World champion Fernando Alonso's McLaren is well clear of the field as he sets the fastest time in Friday practice at the Spanish Grand Prix.



 
Singapore to stage F1 night race
Singapore will stage a Formula One Grand Prix next year, with the race set to be the first to be held at night.



 
Ralf expects F1 drive next season
Ralf Schumacher is confident he will be driving in F1 next season, despite his disappointing start to the 2007 campaign.








ATHLETICS




Legendary running track reopens
A £19m sports complex is opened at the historic site where Roger Bannister broke the four-minute mile.



 
Glasgow begins Commonwealth bid
Glasgow's official 2014 bid document  is on its way to London to be handed over to the Games Federation.



 
Mutai takes Belfast marathon win
Kenyan John Mutai comes close to a record time in claiming victory in the 26th Deep RiverRock Belfast City Marathon on Monday.








CYCLING




Landis in shock Armstrong claim
Floyd Landis claims he has been offered a softer sentence for doping if he provides evidence against Lance Armstrong.



 
Hoy stranded ahead of record bid
Chris Hoy gets stuck in a different part of Bolivia ahead of his world 1km record attempt in La Paz.



 
Cavendish sprints to Dunkirk win
Britain's Mark Cavendish wins a bunched sprint to triumph on stage three of the Four Days of Dunkirk race.








FUN AND GAMES




Review of the week
Freddy Shepherd offers to "carry Michael Owen to Liverpool"



 
Holloway column
"Maybe Blair could be the next manager of Newcastle, if he can take the pressure"



 
Ten to tackle
Test your sporting knowledge of the last seven days
